main event: An unconfirmed sighting of an unidentified object described as 'intermittent fire' observed in Meade, Kansas on June 25, 1952.
interesting points: The sighting lasted two seconds and appeared to be traveling NNW from the west of Meade., The object was observed at an estimated altitude of 20,000 to 40,000 feet., There were no aircraft reported in the area during the time of the sighting., Weather conditions at the time included thin scattered clouds and visibility between 10 to 15 miles., No physical evidence or photographs were available to support the sighting.
witness description: unconfirmed report from an individual in Meade, Kansas
